data.quote: Tenderness is greater proof of love than the most passionate of vows.
data.author: Marlene Dietrich

data.quote: Kindness is the language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: One of the most valuable things we can do to heal one another is listen to each other's stories.
data.author: Rebecca Falls

data.quote: It's a rare thing  graciousness. The shape of it can be acquired  but not  I think  the substance.
data.author: Gertrude Schweitzer

data.quote: Wherever there is a human being  there is an opportunity for a kindness.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: Oh! may each youthful bosom  catch the sacred fire.
data.author: Ann Plato

data.quote: Kindness is the golden chain by which society is bound together.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: The best index to a person's character is (a) how he treats people who can't do him any good  and (b) how he treats people who can't fight back.
data.author: Abigail Van Buren

data.quote: To nourish children and raise them against odds is in any time  any place  more valuable than to fix bolts in cars or design nuclear weapons.
data.author: Marilyn French

data.quote: Sympathy is the charm of human life.
data.author: Grace Aguilar

data.quote: I expect to pass through life but once. If  therefore  there be any kindness I can show  or any good thing I can do for any fellow being  let me do it now ... as I shall not pass this way again.
data.author: William Penn

data.quote: We bear the world and we make it. ... There was never a great man who had not a great mother-it is hardly an exaggeration.
data.author: Olive Schreiner

data.quote: I wonder why it is that we are not all kinder to each other. ... How much the world needs it! How easily it is done!
data.author: Henry Drummond

data.quote: Miss no single opportunity of making some small sacrifice  here by a smiling look  there by a kindly word  always doing the smallest right and doing it all for love.
data.author: Therese of Lisieux

data.quote: After the verb "to Love " "to Help" is the most beautiful verb in the world.
data.author: Bertha von Suttner

data.quote: We are made kind by being kind.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Kindness causes us to learn  and to forget  many things.
data.author: Madame Swetchine

data.quote: There is nothing in life but refraining from hurting others  and comforting those that are sad.
data.author: Olive Schreiner

data.quote: Without kindness  there can be no true joy.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: Wise sayings often fall on barren ground  but a kind word is never thrown away.
data.author: Sir Arthur Helps

data.quote: A word of kindness is seldom spoken in vain  while witty sayings are as easily lost as the pearls slipping from a broken string.
data.author: George Prentice

data.quote: A kind word is like a Spring day.
data.author: Russian proverb

data.quote: Kindness is in our power  even when fondness is not.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: Kindness affects more than severity.
data.author: Aesop

data.quote: Always be a little kinder than necessary.
data.author: Sir James M. Barrie

data.quote: Kindness is the ability to love people more than they deserve.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The sense that someone else cares always helps because it is the sense of love.
data.author: George E. Woodberry

data.quote: Today I bent the truth to be kind  and I have no regret  for I am far surer of what is kind that I am of what is true.
data.author: Robert Brault

data.quote: Kindness  I've discovered  is everything in life.
data.author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

data.quote: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
data.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

data.quote: Goodwill... is an immeasurable and tremendous energy  the atomic energy of the spirit.
data.author: Eleanor B. Stock

data.quote: Goodwill is the mightiest practical force in the universe.
data.author: Charles F. Dole

data.quote: Knowing sorrow well  I learn to succor the distressed.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Compassion is the basis of all morality.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Success has nothing to do with what you gain in life or accomplish for yourself. It's what you do for others.
data.author: Danny Thomas

data.quote: Right Now Is the Time to Be Kind You cannot do a kindness too soon  for you never know how soon it will be too late.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: There's no use in doing a kindness if you do it a day too late.
data.author: Charles Kingsley

data.quote: He who sees a need and waits to be asked for help is as unkind as if he had refused it.
data.author: Dante Alighieri

data.quote: The golden rule is of no use whatsoever unless you realize that it is your move.
data.author: Dr. Frank Crane

data.quote: He gives twice who gives promptly.
data.author: Publilius Syrus

data.quote: Tact is the ability to describe others as they see themselves.
data.author: Mary Pettibone Poole

data.quote: Instead of getting hard ourselves and trying to compete  women should try to give their best qualities to men- bring them softness  teach them how to cry.
data.author: Joan Baez

data.quote: Youth condemns  maturity condones.
data.author: Josephine Preston Peabody

data.quote: It is unfair to hold people responsible for our illusions of them.
data.author: Comtesse Diane

data.quote: The deadliest feeling that can be offered to a woman is pity.
data.author: Vicki Baum

data.quote: People who won't help others in trouble "because they got into trouble through their own fault" would probably not throw a lifeline to a drowning man until they learned whether he fell in through his own fault or not.
data.author: Sydney J. Harris

data.quote: If you judge people  you have no time to love them.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: Justice and judgment lie often a world apart.
data.author: Emmeline Pankhurst

data.quote: With compassion  we see benevolently our own human condition and the condition of our fellow beings. We drop prejudice. We withhold judgment.
data.author: Christina Baldwin

data.quote: A few observations and much reasoning lead to error  many observations and a little reasoning to truth.
data.author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

data.quote: Nobody who is somebody looks down on anybody.
data.author: Margaret Deland

data.quote: Really listening and suspending one's own judgment is necessary in order to understand other people on their own terms. As we have noted  this is a process that requires trust and builds trust.
data.author: Mary Field Belenky

data.quote: Reform is born of need  not pity.
data.author: Rebecca Harding Davis

data.quote: I am convinced that any feeling of exaltation because we have people under us should be conquered  for I am sure that if we enjoy being over people  there will be something in our manner which will make them dislike being under us.
data.author: Mary Parker Follett

data.quote: "Honesty" without compassion and understanding is not honesty  but subtle hostility.
data.author: Rose N. Franzblau

data.quote: Theories and goals of education don't matter a whit if you do not consider your students to be human beings.
data.author: Lou Ann Walker

data.quote: It's compassion that makes gods of us.
data.author: Dorothy Gilman

data.quote: When God made up this world of ours  He made it long and wide  And meant that it should shelter all  And none should be denied.
data.author: Carrie Jacobs Bond

data.quote: I've always thought that people need to feel good about themselves and I see my role as offering support to them  to provide some light along the way.
data.author: Diana, Princess of Wales

data.quote: The finest inheritance you can give a child is to allow it to make its own way  completely on its own feet.
data.author: Isadora Duncan

data.quote: Let our girls feel that we expect something more of them than that they merely look pretty and appear well in society. Teach them that there is a race with special needs which they and only they can help  that the world needs and is already asking for their trained and efficient forces.
data.author: Anna Julia Cooper

data.quote: A child is a temporarily disabled and stunted version of a larger person  whom you will someday know. Your job is to help them overcome the disabilities associated with their size and inexperience so that they get on with being that larger person.
data.author: Barbara Ehrenreich

data.quote: We have to improve life  not just for those who have the most skills and those who know how to manipulate the system. But also for and with those who often have so much to give but never get the opportunity.
data.author: Dorothy Height

data.quote: The most notable fact that culture imprints on women is the sense of our limits. The most important thing one woman can do for another is to illuminate and expand her sense of actual possibilities.
data.author: Adrienne Rich

data.quote: First  teach a person to develop to the point of his limitations and then- pfft!-break the limitations.
data.author: Viola Spolin

data.quote: If you want a baby  have a new one. Don't baby the old one.
data.author: Jessamyn West

data.quote: When anything gets freed  a zest goes round the world.
data.author: Hortense Calisher

data.quote: If we can't turn the world around we can at least bolster the victims.
data.author: Liz Carpenter

data.quote: If a child is too keep alive his inborn sense of wonder ... he needs the companionship of at least one adult who can share it  rediscovering with him the joy  excitement  and mystery of the world we live in.
data.author: Rachel Carson

data.quote: We ought to be doing all we can to make it possible for every child to fulfill his or her God-given potential.
data.author: Hillary Rodham Clinton

data.quote: You cannot create genius. All you can do is nurture it.
data.author: Ninette de Valois

data.quote: Most convicted felons are just people who were not taken to museums or Broadway musicals as children.
data.author: Libby Gelman-Waxner

data.quote: No one has yet realized the wealth of sympathy  the kindness and generosity hidden in the soul of a child. The effort of every true education should be to unlock that treasure.
data.author: Emma Goldman

data.quote: I'm not an American hero. I'm a person who loves children.
data.author: Clara McBride Hale

data.quote: When a person is down in the world  an ounce of help is better than a pound of preaching.
data.author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

data.quote: The greatest gift is the passion for reading. It is cheap  it consoles  it distracts  it excites  it gives you knowledge of the world and experience of a wide kind. It is a moral illumination.
data.author: Elizabeth Hardwick

data.quote: A little help is worth a great deal of pity.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Don't give advice unless you're asked.
data.author: Amy Alcott

data.quote: Generosity gives assistance  rather than advice.
data.author: Vauvenargues

data.quote: Our worth is determined by the good deeds we do  rather than by the fine emotions we feel.
data.author: Elias L. Magoon

data.quote: Nagging is the repetition of unpalatable truths.
data.author: Baroness Edith Summerskill

data.quote: Orthodox criticism ... is a murderer of talent. And because the most modest and sensitive people are the most talented  having the most imagination and sympathy  these are the first ones to get killed off.
data.author: Brenda Ueland

data.quote: With every deed you are sowing a seed  though the harvest you may not see.
data.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

data.quote: Giving kids clothes and food is one thing  but it's much more important to teach them that other people besides themselves are important and that the best thing they can do with their lives is to use them in the service of other people.
data.author: Dolores Huerta

data.quote: What its children become  that will the community become.
data.author: Suzannea LaFollette

data.quote: A child is fed with milk and praise.
data.author: Mary Lamb

data.quote: Children are forced to live very rapidly in order to live at all. They are given only a few years in which to learn hundreds of thousands of things about life and the planet and themselves.
data.author: Phyllis McGinley

data.quote: Live and let live is not enough  live and help live is not too much.
data.author: Orison Swett Marden

data.quote: To give pleasure to a single heart by a single kind act is better than a thousand head-bowings in prayer.
data.author: Sa'di

data.quote: Establishing lasting peace is the work of education  all politics can do is keep us out of war.
data.author: Maria Montessori

data.quote: Pity costs nothing and ain't worth nothing.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: The greatness of the human personality begins at the hour of birth. From this almost mystic affirmation there comes what may seem a strange conclusion: that education must start from birth.
data.author: Maria Montessori

data.quote: To feel sorry for the needy is not the mark of a Christian-to help them is.
data.author: Frank A. Clark

data.quote: What we remember from childhood we remember forever-permanent ghosts  stamped  imprinted  eternally seen.
data.author: Cynthia Ozick

data.quote: I don't believe civilization can do a lot more than educate a person's senses.
data.author: Grace Paley

data.quote: 'Tis not enough to help the feeble up  but to support him after.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Where our bread is concerned  it is a material matter. Where our neighbor's bread is concerned  it is a spiritual matter.
data.author: I. D. Douglas

data.quote: A good education is that which prepares us for our future sphere of action and makes us contented with that situation in life in which God  in his infinite mercy  has seen fit to place us  to be perfectly resigned to our lot in life  whatever it may be.
data.author: Ann Plato

data.quote: Teaching was the hardest work I had ever done  and it remains the hardest work I have done to date.
data.author: Ann Richards

data.quote: To me education is a leading out of what is already there in the pupil's soul.
data.author: Muriel Spark

data.quote: To throw obstacles in the way of a complete education is like putting out the eyes.
data.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

data.quote: No other job in the world could possibly dispossess one so completely as this job of teaching. You could stand all day in a laundry  for instance  still in possession of your mind. But this teaching utterly obliterates you. It cuts right into your being: essentially  it takes over your spirit.
data.author: Sylvia Ashton-Warner

data.quote: Teaching is the royal road to learning.
data.author: Jessamyn West

data.quote: Teaching was the best way to learn.
data.author: Edna Gardner Whyte

data.quote: Teaching is the greatest act of optimism.
data.author: Colleen Wilcox

data.quote: I think education is power. I think that being able to communicate with people is power. One of my main goals on the planet is to encourage people to empower themselves.
data.author: Oprah Winfrey

data.quote: If you feed a man a meal  you only feed him for a day-but if you teach a man to grow food  you feed him for a lifetime.
data.author: Peace Pilgrim

data.quote: People will support that which they help to create.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches  but to reveal to him his own.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: Listen long enough and the person will generally come up with an adequate solution.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: The truest help we can render an afflicted man is not to take his burden from him  but to call out his best energy  that he may be able to bear the burden.
data.author: Phillips Brooks

data.quote: A mother is not a person to lean on but a person to make leaning unnecessary.
data.author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher

data.quote: A wise parent humors the desire for independent action  so as to become the friend and advisor when his absolute rule shall cease.
data.author: Elizabeth Gaskell

data.quote: Time and money spent in helping men to do more for themselves is far better than mere giving.
data.author: Henry Ford

data.quote: I don't give advice. I can't tell anybody what to do. Instead I say this is what we know about this problem at this time. And here are the consequences of these actions.
data.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

data.quote: Hold up to him his better self  his real self that can dare and do and win out. ... People radiate what is in their minds and in their hearts.
data.author: Eleanor H. Porter

data.quote: The manager cannot share his power with division superintendent or foreman or workman  but he can give them opportunities for developing their power.
data.author: Mary Parker Follett

data.quote: Once you wake up thought in a man  you can never put it to sleep again.
data.author: Zora Neale Hurston

data.quote: Never help a child with a task at which he feels he can succeed.
data.author: Maria Montessori

data.quote: To know one's self is wisdom  but to know one's neighbor is genius.
data.author: Minna Antrim

data.quote: Gossip is a sort of smoke that comes from the dirty tobacco-pipes of those who diffuse it  it proves nothing but the bad taste of the smoker.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: I know that everyone brings to the work his or her own experiences and background and may interpret the piece like a Rorschach  in their own way.
data.author: Ida Applebroog

data.quote: There are no little events in life  those we think of no consequence may be full of fate  and it is at our own risk if we neglect the acquaintances and opportunities that seem to be casually offered  and of small importance.
data.author: Amelia Barr

data.quote: I believe every person has the ability to achieve something important  and with that in mind I regard everyone as special.
data.author: Mary Kay Ash

data.quote: The fact that we are human beings is infinitely more important than all the peculiarities that distinguish human beings from one another.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: The sexes in each species of beings . . . are always true equivalents-equals but not identicals.
data.author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

data.quote: To understand another human being you must gain some insight into the conditions which made him what he is.
data.author: Margaret Bourke-White

data.quote: Like snowflakes  the human pattern is never cast twice. We are uncommonly and marvelously intricate in thought and action.
data.author: Alice Childress

data.quote: Everyone needs to be valued. Everyone has the potential to give something back.
data.author: Diana, Princess of Wales

data.quote: Every human being is trying to say something to others. Trying to cry out I am alive  notice me! Speak to me! Confirm that I am important  that I matter!
data.author: Marion D. Hanks

data.quote: The Christian tradition was passed on to me as a great rich mixture  a bouillabaisse of human imagination and wonder brewed from the richness of individual lives.
data.author: Mary Bateson

data.quote: Connected knowers do not measure other people's words by some impersonal standard. Their purpose is not to judge but to understand.
data.author: Mary Field Belenky

data.quote: Tyranny and anarchy are alike incompatible with freedom  security  and the enjoyment of opportunity.
data.author: Jeane Kirkpatrick

data.quote: Unless one's philosophy is all-inclusive  nothing can be understood.
data.author: Mary Ritter Beard

data.quote: Nature is just enough  but men and women must comprehend and accept her suggestions.
data.author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

data.quote: The motto should not be: Forgive one another  rather understand one another.
data.author: Emma Goldman

data.quote: Someone has said that it requires less mental effort to condemn than to think.
data.author: Emma Goldman

data.quote: We cannot safely assume that other people's minds work on the same principles as our own. All too often  others with whom we come in contact do not reason as we reason  or do not value the things we value  or are not interested in what interests us.
data.author: Isabel Briggs Myers

data.quote: To have one's individuality completely ignored is like being pushed quite out of life. Like being blown out as one blows out a light.
data.author: Evelyn Scott

data.quote: It's funny how your initial approach to a person can determine your feelings toward them  no matter what facts develop later on.
data.author: Dorothy Uhnak

data.quote: Nobody really knows Indians who cheat them and treat them badly.
data.author: Sarah Winnemucca

data.quote: [Tolerance] is the greatest gift of the mind  it requires the same effort of the brain that it takes to balance oneself on a bicycle.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Africa has her mysteries  and even a wise man cannot understand them. But a wise man respects them.
data.author: Miriam Makeba

data.quote: To argue over who is the more noble is nothing more than to dispute whether dirt is better for making bricks or for making mortar.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: What women want is what men want. They want respect.
data.author: Marilyn vos Savant

data.quote: All sweeping assertions are erroneous.
data.author: L. E. Landon

data.quote: Truth has never been  can never be  contained in any one creed or system.
data.author: Mary Augusta Ward

data.quote: Sons branch out  but one woman leads to another.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: It's really important that  as women  we tell our stories. That is what helps seed our imaginations.
data.author: Ann Bancroft

data.quote: Female friendships that work are relationships in which women help each other belong to themselves.
data.author: Louise Bernikow

data.quote: Women's propensity to share confidences is universal. We confirm our reality by sharing.
data.author: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison

data.quote: Sharing is sometimes more demanding than giving.
data.author: Mary Bateson

data.quote: If my hands are fully occupied in holding on to something  I can neither give nor receive.
data.author: Dorothy Solle

data.quote: We are rich only through what we give  and poor only through what we refuse.
data.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

data.quote: Find out how much God has given you and from it take what you need  the remainder is needed by others.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: [Our children] had the privilege of growing up where they'd raised a lot of food. They were never hungry. They could share their food with people. And so  you share your lives with people.
data.author: Ella Baker

data.quote: For we must share  if we would keep  that blessing from above  Ceasing to give  we cease to have  such is the law of love.
data.author: Richard C. Trench

data.quote: An unshared life is not living. He who shares does not lessen  but great-ens  his life.
data.author: Stephen S. Wise

data.quote: Sharing what you have is more important than what you have.
data.author: Albert M. Wells

data.quote: You cannot always have happiness  but you can always give happiness.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: That's what I consider true generosity. You give your all and yet you always feel as if it costs you nothing.
data.author: Simone de Beauvoir

data.quote: A cup that is already full cannot have more added to it. In order to receive the further good to which we are entitled  we must give of that which we have.
data.author: Margaret Becker

data.quote: The fragrance always stays in the hand that gives the rose.
data.author: Heda Bejar

data.quote: You can give without loving  but you cannot love without giving.
data.author: Amy Carmichael

data.quote: Measure thy life by loss instead of gain  Not by the wine drunk  but by the wine poured forth.
data.author: Harriet King

data.quote: Be charitable and indulgent to every one but thyself.
data.author: Joseph Joubert

data.quote: Be pretty if you can  be witty if you must  but be gracious if it kills you.
data.author: Elsie de Wolfe

data.quote: Real unselfishness consists in sharing the interests of others.
data.author: George Santayana

data.quote: Purposeful giving is not as apt to deplete one's resources  it belongs to that natural order of giving that seems to renew itself even in the act of depletion.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: If my hands are fully occupied in holding on to something  I can neither give nor receive.
data.author: Dorothy Solle

data.quote: Whoever in trouble and sorrow needs your help  give it to him. Whoever in anxiety or fear needs your friendship  give it to him. It isn't important whether he likes you. It isn't important whether you approve of his conduct. It isn't important what his creed or nationality may be.
data.author: E. N. West

data.quote: I was hungered  and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty  and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger  and ye took me in: I was naked  and ye clothed me: I was sick  and ye visited me: I was in prison  and ye came unto me.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Generosity with strings is not generosity: it is a deal.
data.author: Marya Mannes

data.quote: To give and then not feel that one has given is the very best of all ways of giving.
data.author: Max Beerbohm

data.quote: To have and not to give is often worse than to steal.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: It is more blessed to give than to receive.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: God loveth a cheerful giver.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: Almsgiving leaves a man just where he was before. Aid restores him to society as an individual worthy of all respect and not as a man with a grievance.
data.author: Eva Peron

data.quote: In necessary things  unity  in doubtful things  liberty  in all things  charity.
data.author: Richard Baxter

data.quote: Real charity and a real ability never to condemn-the one real virtue-is so often the result of a waking experience that gives a glimpse of what lies beneath things.
data.author: Ivy Compton-Burnett

data.quote: We must give alms. Charity wins souls and draws them to virtue.
data.author: Angela Merici

data.quote: Did universal charity prevail  earth would be a heaven  and hell a fable.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: The results of philanthropy are always beyond calculation.
data.author: Miriam Beard

data.quote: I have as little fear that God will damn a man that has charity as I hope that the priests can save one who has not.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: Charity. To love human beings in so far as they are nothing. That is to love them as God does.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: An institution or reform movement that is not selfish  must originate in the recognition of some evil that is adding to the sum of human suffering  or diminishing the sum of happiness. I suppose it is a philanthropic movement to try to reverse the process.
data.author: Clara Barton

data.quote: In faith and hope the world will disagree  but all mankind's concern is charity.
data.author: Alexander Pope

data.quote: There is no real religious experience that does not express itself in charity.
data.author: C. H. Dodd

data.quote: Charity begins at home  and usually stays there.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Charity begins at home  but should not end there.
data.author: Thomas Fuller

data.quote: Sow good services  sweet remembrances will grow from them.
data.author: Madame de Stael

data.quote: Charity looks at the need  not at the cause.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: Make the world better.
data.author: Lucy Stone

data.quote: He is rich who hath enough to be charitable.
data.author: Sir Thomas Browne

data.quote: He that has no charity deserves no mercy.
data.author: English proverb

data.quote: Give what you have. To someone else it may be better than you dare to think.
data.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

data.quote: Discipline is a symbol of caring to a child. He needs guidance. If there is love  there is no such thing as being too tough with a child.
data.author: Bette Davis

data.quote: Even if it's a little thing  do something for those who have need of help  something for which you get no pay but the privilege of doing it.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: Give  if thou can  an alms  if not  a sweet and gentle word.
data.author: Robert Herrick

data.quote: Two thirds of help is to give courage.
data.author: Irish proverb

data.quote: It was only a sunny smile  And little it cost in the giving. But like morning light  it scattered the night  And made the day worth living.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The principle was right there-you couldn't miss it. The more you did for your customers  the more they did for us.
data.author: Debbi Fields

data.quote: What boundary ever set limits to the service of mankind?
data.author: Claudian

data.quote: Kindness consists in loving people more than they deserve.
data.author: Jacqueline Schiff

data.quote: I hate the giving of the hand unless the whole man accompanies it.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: You can never expect too much of yourself in the matter of giving yourself to others.
data.author: Theodore C. Speers

data.quote: Isn't it better to have men be ungrateful  than to miss a chance to do good?
data.author: Denis Diderot

data.quote: Better to expose ourselves to ingratitude than fail in assisting the unfortunate.
data.author: Du Coeur

data.quote: Behold! I do not give lectures on a little charity. When I give  I give myself.
data.author: Walt Whitman

data.quote: To be one woman  truly  wholly  is to be all women. Tend one garden and you will birth worlds.
data.author: Kate Braverman

data.quote: One filled with joy preaches without preaching.
data.author: Mother Teresa

data.quote: Simply give others a bit of yourself  a thoughtful act  a helpful idea  a word of appreciation  a lift over a rough spot  a sense of understanding  a timely suggestion. You take something out of your mind  garnished in kindness out of your heart  and put it into the other fellow's mind and heart.
data.author: Charles H. Burr

data.quote: The only gift is a portion of thyself.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Blessed influence of one truly loving soul on another!
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: When one is frank  one's very presence is a compliment.
data.author: Marianne Moore

data.quote: There is no greater loan than a sympathetic ear.
data.author: Frank Tyger

data.quote: Do not inflict your will. Just give love. The soul will take that love and put it where it can best be used.
data.author: Emmanuel

data.quote: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
data.author: Kahlil Gibran

data.quote: A hurtful act is the transference to others of the degradation which we bear in ourselves.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: We are cold to others only when we are dull in ourselves.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: As long as you keep a person down  some part of you has to be down there to hold him down  so it means you cannot soar as you otherwise might.
data.author: Marian Anderson

data.quote: Cruelty is the only sin.
data.author: Ellen Glasgow

data.quote: Violence is a symptom of impotence.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: The mortal sickness of a mind too unhappy to be kind.
data.author: A. E. Housman

data.quote: Where there is no capacity to affirm another as a person in his own right  there is no love. There is only masked fear.
data.author: Bonaro Overstreet

data.quote: In real love you want the other person's good.
data.author: Margaret Anderson

data.quote: It is only in the giving of oneself to others that we truly live.
data.author: Ethel Percy Andrus

data.quote: One cannot make oneself  but one can sometimes help a little in the making of somebody else.
data.author: Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

data.quote: Giving presents is a talent  to know what a person wants  to know when and how to get it  to give it lovingly and well.
data.author: Pamela Glenconner

data.quote: The habit of being uniformly considerate toward others will bring increased happiness to you.
data.author: Grenville Kleiser

data.quote: There are times when sympathy is as necessary as the air we breathe.
data.author: Rose Pastor Stokes

data.quote: He who does not live in some degree for others  hardly lives for himself.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: It is no good to think that other people are out to serve our interests.
data.author: Ivy Compton-Burnett

data.quote: Love is a choice-not simply  or necessarily  a rational choice  but rather a willingness to be present to others without pretense or guile.
data.author: Carter Heyward

data.quote: I wish that every child could have growing space because I think children are a little like plants. If they grow too close together  they become thin and sickly and never obtain maximum growth. We need room to grow.
data.author: Peace Pilgrim

data.quote: We cannot hold a torch to light another's path without brightening our own.
data.author: Ben Sweetland

data.quote: What I spent  is gone  what I kept  I lost  but what I gave away will be mine forever.
data.author: Ethel Percy Andrus

data.quote: In helping others  we shall help ourselves  for whatever good we give out completes the circle and comes back to us.
data.author: Flora Edwards

data.quote: An act of goodness is of itself an act of happiness.
data.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

data.quote: My happiness derives from knowing the people I love are happy.
data.author: Holly Ketchel

data.quote: There is nothing to make you like other human beings so much as doing things for them.
data.author: Zora Neale Hurston

data.quote: Happiness ... is achieved only by making others happy.
data.author: Stuart Cloete

data.quote: The most infectiously joyous men and women are those who forget themselves in thinking about others and serving others.
data.author: Robert J. McCracken

data.quote: Giving opens the way for receiving.
data.author: Florence Scovel Shinn

data.quote: Fill the cup of happiness for others  and there will be enough overflowing to fill yours to the brim.
data.author: Rose Pastor Stokes

data.quote: Nothing liberates our greatness like the desire to help  the desire to serve.
data.author: Marianne Williamson

data.quote: He that will not permit his wealth to do any good for others ... cuts himself off from the truest pleasure here and the highest happiness later.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: The closer I'm bound in love to you  the closer I am to free.
data.author: Indigo Girls

data.quote: True religion ... is giving and finding one's happiness by bringing happiness into the lives of others.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: Power is the ability to do good things for others.
data.author: Brooke Astor

data.quote: If you give your life as a wholehearted response to love  then love will wholeheartedly respond to you.
data.author: Marianne Williamson

data.quote: Pleasure is a reciprocal  no one feels it who does not at the same time give it. To be pleased  one must please.
data.author: Lord Chesterfield

data.quote: When their children flourish  almost all mothers have a sense of well-being.
data.author: Sara Ruddick

data.quote: If we had no regard for others' feelings or fortune  we would grow cold and indifferent to life itself.
data.author: George Matthew Adams

data.quote: To devote a portion of one's leisure to doing something for someone else is one of the highest forms of recreation.
data.author: Gerald B. Fitzgerald

data.quote: Live for thy neighbor if thou wouldst live for thyself.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: The true way to soften one's troubles is to solace those of others.
data.author: Madame De Maintenon

data.quote: Anything done for another is done for oneself.
data.author: Boniface VIII

data.quote: What we frankly give  forever is our own.
data.author: George Granville

data.quote: Every charitable act is a stepping stone toward heaven.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: The human being who lives only for himself finally reaps nothing but unhappiness. Selfishness corrodes. Unselfishness ennobles  satisfies. Don't put off the joy derivable from doing helpful  kindly things for others.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: There is no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up.
data.author: John Andrew Holmes

data.quote: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Help your brother's boat across  and your own will reach the shore.
data.author: Hindu proverb

data.quote: Be unselfish.... If you think of yourself only  you cannot develop because you are choking the source of development  which is spiritual expansion through thought for others.
data.author: Charles W. Eliot

data.quote: An effort made for the happiness of others lifts us above ourselves.
data.author: Lydia M. Child

data.quote: Happiness ... consists in giving  and in serving others.
data.author: Henry Drummond

data.quote: Try to forget yourself in the service of others. For when we think too much of ourselves and our own interests  we easily become despondent. But when we work for others  our efforts return to bless us.
data.author: Sidney Powell

data.quote: Doing good is the only certainly happy action of a man's life.
data.author: Sir Philip Sidney

data.quote: The greatest happiness in the world is to make others happy.
data.author: Luther Burbank

data.quote: We make a living by what we get  but we make a life by what we give.
data.author: Norman MacEwan

data.quote: You may not have saved a lot of money in your life  but if you have saved a lot of heartaches for other folks  you are a pretty rich man.
data.author: Seth Parker

data.quote: Only a life lived for others is a life worth while.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Unless we give part of ourselves away  unless we can live with other people and understand them and help them  we are missing the most essential part of our own lives.
data.author: Harold Taylor

data.quote: To complain that life has no joys while there is a single creature whom we can relieve by our bounty  assist by our counsels or enliven by our presence  is to lament the loss of that which we possess  and is just as rational as to die of thirst with the cup in our hands.
data.author: Thomas Fitzosborne

data.quote: If you have not often felt the joy of doing a kind act  you have neglected much  and most of all yourself.
data.author: A. Neilen

data.quote: As the purse is emptied  the heart is filled.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: Goodwill to others ... helps build you up. It is good for your body. It makes your blood purer  your muscles stronger  and your whole form more symmetrical in shape. It is the real elixir of life.
data.author: Prentice Mulford

data.quote: Set about doing good to somebody. Put on your hat and go and visit the sick and poor of your neighborhood  inquire into their circumstances and minister to their wants. Seek out the desolate and afflicted and oppressed ... I have often tried this method  and have always found it the best medicine for a heavy heart.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: We grow by love ... others are our nutriment.
data.author: William Ellery Channing

data.quote: When you learn to live for others  they will live for you.
data.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

data.quote: No man is more cheated than the selfish man.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: In about the same degree as you are helpful  you will be happy.
data.author: Karl Reiland

data.quote: He that despiseth his neighbor sin-neth  but he that hath mercy on the poor  happy is he.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: The most exquisite pleasure is giving pleasure to others.
data.author: Jean de la Bruyere

data.quote: Happiness is a by-product of an effort to make someone else happy.
data.author: Gretta Brooker Palmer

data.quote: The fragrance of what you give away stays with you.
data.author: Earl Allen

data.quote: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others  but it also becomes richer and happier.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: Sow good services  sweet remembrances will grow from them.
data.author: Madame de Stael

data.quote: We all of us need assistance. Those who sustain others themselves want to be sustained.
data.author: Maurice Hulst

data.quote: When you cease to make a contribution  you begin to die.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: To help all created things  that is the measure of our responsibility  to be helped by all  that is the measure of our hope.
data.author: Gerald Vann

data.quote: Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves.
data.author: Sir James M. Barrie

data.quote: When one's own problems are unsolvable and all best efforts are frustrated  it is lifesaving to listen to other people's problems.
data.author: Suzanne Massie

data.quote: The best way to cheer yourself is to try to cheer somebody else up.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: There is no happiness in having or in getting  but only in giving.
data.author: Henry Drummond

data.quote: Do things for others and you'll find your self-consciousness evaporating like morning dew.
data.author: Dale Carnegie

data.quote: There remain times when one can only endure. One lives on  one doesn't die  and the only thing that one can do  is to fill one's mind and time as far as possible with the concerns of other people. It doesn't bring immediate peace  but it brings the dawn nearer.
data.author: Arthur Christopher Benson

data.quote: Avarice hoards itself poor  charity gives itself rich.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: The hearts that never lean must fall.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: The people you need to help you make your dream come true are everywhere  and within your reach.
data.author: Marcia Wieder

data.quote: Like the body that is made up of different limbs and organs  all mortal creatures exist depending upon one another.
data.author: Hindu proverb

data.quote: We not only need to be willing to give  but also to be open to receiving from others.
data.author: On Hope

data.quote: It seems sometimes as if one were powerless to do any more from within to overcome troubles  and that help must come from without.
data.author: Arthur Christopher Benson

data.quote: The smartest thing I ever said was  "Help Me!"
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: The healthy and strong individual is the one who asks for help when he needs it. Whether he's got an abscess on his knee  or in his soul.
data.author: Rona Barrett

data.quote: The healthy  the strong individual  is the one who asks for help when he needs it. Whether he has an abscess on his knee or in his soul.
data.author: Rona Barrett

data.quote: My only advice is to stay aware  listen carefully and yell for help if you need it.
data.author: Judy Blume

data.quote: Silence is not certain token That no secret grief is there  Sorrow which is never spoken Is the heaviest load to bear.
data.author: Frances Ridley Havergal

data.quote: It is true that no one can harm the person who wears armor. But no one can help him either.
data.author: Kristin Hunter

data.quote: We can't help everyone  but everyone can help someone.
data.author: Dr. Loretta Scott

data.quote: Trouble is part of your life  and if you don't share it  you don't give the person who loves you a chance to love you enough.
data.author: Dinah Shore

data.quote: Get the knack of getting people to help you and also pitch in yourself.
data.author: Ruth Gordon

data.quote: I've discovered I'm a strong and capable person. I can handle almost anything except being alone with this.
data.author: Keith Gann

data.quote: You really can change the world if you care enough.
data.author: Marian Wright Edelman

data.quote: Service is the rent we pay for the privilege of living on this earth.
data.author: Shirley Chisholm

data.quote: We want to create an atmosphere in which creation is possible.
data.author: Marie Rambert

data.quote: All altruism springs from putting yourself in the other person's place.
data.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

data.quote: A helping word to one in trouble is often like a switch on a railroad track ... an inch between wreck and smooth  rolling prosperity.
data.author: Henry Ward Beecher

data.quote: Often we can help each other most by leaving each other alone  at other times we need the hand-grasp and the word of cheer.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: If I can stop one heart from breaking  I shall not live in vain.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: It takes wisdom and discernment to minister to people in need. We must look beyond the apparent and seek to meet the needs of the whole person.
data.author: Richard C. Chewning

data.quote: If I am not for myself  who will be for me? If I am not for others  who am I for? And if not now  when?
data.author: Talmud

data.quote: Believe  when you are most unhappy  that there is something for you to do in the world. So long as you can sweeten another's pain  life is not in vain.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Much misconstruction and bitterness are spared to him who thinks naturally upon what he owes to others  rather than on what he ought to expect from them.
data.author: Elizabeth de Meulan Guizot

data.quote: If we could all hear one another's prayers  God might be relieved of some of his burden.
data.author: Ashleigh Brilliant

data.quote: I know some good marriages-marriages where both people are just trying to get through their days by helping each other  being good to each other.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: The entire sum of existence is the magic of being needed by just one person.
data.author: Vi Putnam

data.quote: Happiness is the cheapest thing in the world when we buy it for someone else.
data.author: Paul Flemming

data.quote: Who is the happiest of men? He who values the merits of others  and in their pleasure takes joy  even as though it were his own.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: The race of mankind would perish did they cease to aid each other. We cannot exist without mutual help. All therefore that need aid have a right to ask it from their fellow man  and no one who has the power of granting can refuse it without guilt.
data.author: Sir Walter Scott

data.quote: It is the individual who is not interested in his fellow men who has the greatest difficulties in life and provides the greatest injury to others. It is from among such individuals that all human failures spring.
data.author: Alfred Adler

data.quote: Make yourself necessary to somebody.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: It is enough that I am of value to somebody today.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: And they said one to another  We are verily guilty concerning our brother  in that we saw the anguish of his soul  when he besought us  and we would not hear.
data.author: Bible

data.quote: A man finds room in a few square inches of his face for the traits of all his ancestors  for the expression of all his history  and his wants.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Every man is the son of his own works.
data.author: Cervantes

data.quote: Heredity is nothing but stored environment.
data.author: Luther Burbank

data.quote: One of the best things people could do for their descendants would be to sharply limit the number of them.
data.author: Olin Miller

data.quote: A man's rootage is more important than his leafage.
data.author: Woodrow Wilson

data.quote: Nothing is so soothing to our self-esteem as to find our bad traits in our forebears. It seems to absolve us.
data.author: Van Wyck Brooks

data.quote: Heredity is an omnibus in which all our ancestors ride  and every now and then one of them puts his head out and embarrasses us.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: It is indeed a desirable thing to be well descended  but the glory belongs to our ancestors.
data.author: Plutarch

data.quote: With him for a sire  and her for a dam What should I be  but just what I am?
data.author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

data.quote: The child is father to the man.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: Gentility is what is left over from rich ancestors after the money is gone.
data.author: John Ciardi

data.quote: Whoever serves his country well has no need of ancestors.
data.author: Voltaire

data.quote: The best blood will sometimes get into a fool or a mosquito.
data.author: Austin O'Malley

data.quote: The man who has not anything to boast of but his illustrious ancestors is like a potato - the only good belonging to him is underground.
data.author: Thomas Overbury

data.quote: A genealogist is one who traces your family back as far as your money will go.
data.author: Anonymous
